p: Geophila repens (L.) I.M. Johnst belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is widely distributed in the tropics and subtropics of Africa, Asia, through the Pacific to the Americas and Caribbean. It is a creeping, evergreen, perennial herb growing up to 10 cm tall and often forming dense close colonies in shaded places. The leaves of Geophila repens are sometimes chewed to remedy coughs. And a decoction of the boiled plant is also used as a treatment for coughs. The fruits of Geophila repens are considered to be an effective antifungal agent [ 17].
